sub_title: Executive Assistant to Chief Strategic Planning and Membership at ITU
summary:
I have 30+ years of experience coordinating and controlling secretarial/administrative activities, most recently at Board level (for CEOs and Executive Committee), with a strong background in Human Resources, including several years of experience working within the United Nations Organization's in Geneva, Switzerland.
	   
•	Methodical and analytical, hard-working with a good sense of organization, initiative, judgment and attention to detail.
•	Highly flexible and adaptable in applying new methodologies in ways of working.
•	Proven ability to prioritize and work under pressure to tight deadlines and to coordinate the execution of multiple activities.
•	In-depth knowledge of MS DOS / Windows / Internet /  Google Apps for Business (Gmail, Calendar, Drive) and of Microsoft Office (Powerpoint, Excel, Word, etc.) / Web publishing / Electronic Conversions.


Specialties: LANGUAGES: Fluent in Spanish, English, French, good knowledge of Portuguese and Dutch and basic German

certifications.name: How to Proactively Manage Conflict as an Employee
Think Like a Lawyer to Make Decisions and Solve Problems
Be the Manager People Won't Leave
Proven Tips for Managing Your Time
Bad Boss: Dealing with a Difficult Manager
Creating a Positive and Healthy Work Environment

profile_positions.description:
Provide administrative support to the Chief SPM with respect to communications, meetings, and workflows; identifying complex or sensitive subjects, and contacts for special treatment as well as priority issues that need to be brought to the supervisor's attention; as appropriate, provide information and guidance to staff at all levels within the Department to ensure understanding of intent and deadlines.

Provide administrative support to the Chief SPM at all important ITU meetings, conferences, and events, including Plenipotentiary Conferences, Council meetings, WSIS Forum and other high-level meetings, ensuring relevant supporting documentation is available for his/her use.

Organize meetings convened by the Chief SPM including taking responsibility for the administrative details and logistics, the finalization of the agenda, invitations, the production and distribution of documentation, drafts summary records and ensures that action is taken on decisions.

Coordinate travel arrangements, schedules, and reservations for the Chief SPM's official travel; ensuring that travel arrangements and appointments are made and timely collection and coordination of briefing material and background documentation for the Chief prior to missions.
profile_positions.title: Executive Assistant to Chief Strategic Planning and Membership (SPM)

profile_positions.description:
•	Extensive calendar management and travel planning for the COO. Strategically manage time. Looking at long term travel calendar, evaluating opportunities and determining fit with priorities. Ensure that materials and time is well spend and objectives achieved. Facilitate meeting preparation and follow up.
•	Proactive Inbox management. Research incoming issues that need more background, identify those that require COO action, and those that can be completed by me or others in the management team. Remind the COO and follow-up proactively. Put incoming issues and concerns into actionable-ready format. 
•	Help drive the list of projects that COO is involved in with high complexity in accordance with the relevant strategy and business plan contributing to the realization of business goals. At times, partner with Strategy and PMO for schedule planning, and problem solving. Draft, prepare and produce presentations and meeting material. 
•	Manage the admin procedures with various internal systems (logging vacation days in SAP, fill in the Expat tax travel calendar, files hard and soft documents, handle expenses and approvals creating administrative stability, etc.) making sure deadlines are met, good housekeeping.  
•	Coordinate daily/weekly/monthly/annual standard work and business cycle activities including confidential tasks such as the yearly Performance Management, Quarterly reviews, People Performance reviews. Ensure proactive and close collaboration with stakeholders across the organization in the HQ and the global management team to maximize effectiveness. Build deep relationships, anticipate challenges and propose solutions.
•	Maintain confidence and protects the department by keeping information confidential.
•	Establishes and maintains highly effective working relationships in terms of presentation, hosting, preparation with senior management, and other appointed officials, business leaders, board members, and others encountered in the course of work.
profile_positions.title: Executive Assistant to Chief Operations Officer - Mr. Keith Svendsen
Executive Assistant to Chief Portfolio Officer - Mr Peder Sondergaard

profile_positions.description:
Assisting SVP Finance as well as the Dutch team and in addition filing SOX documentation and review for flux analysis amongst others.

•	Direct Support to SVP Finance Operations 
a)	Provide a consistent level of high quality support to the SVP Finance operations and his direct reports by performing administrative duties related to the scope of his role. 
b)	Complied agendas
c)	Prepare correspondence, applying language skills to appropriately create communications for local and external audience
d)	Screen e-mails and calls
e)	Any other general executive assistant and administrative duties such as preparing expenses report, filing, creating POs in COUPA, travel organization, etc. 
f)	Open to new challenges and unexpected assignments.

•	Process development & Maintenance – SOX compliance
a)	Ensure that office’s polices and processes are maintained.
b)	Support the Consolidation team’s SOX control documentation creation, evidence communication maintenance (e.g., flux controls, highlight memos, meeting minutes, etc.)
c)	Support SVP Finance Operations in his role as a process owner and control performer/reviewer, by ensuring timely performance of controls as well as appropriate maintenance of evidence.
d)	Assist design and testing teams (internal and external audits) with gathering SOX control evidence.

•	Thinking ahead to facilitate a fast connection between the SVP Finance Operations and the rest of the business.
profile_positions.title: Executive Assistant to Maarten van Gool - SVP Finance

profile_positions.description:
•	Coordinating the President/CEO participation in events worldwide such as BoD meetings (for the company and for external companies in which he is also a Board Member), forums, conferences, etc.
•	Play the key role organizing meetings and events taking place on and off site. Monthly management meetings, Board meetings, Annual General Shareholders meeting, Investors meetings etc., ensuring budgets are maintained and events are implemented smoothly and professionally.
•	Generate weekly and monthly reports and assisting with other reports as needed: KPI’s, Holiday Schedule, Organization Charts, etc.
•	Coordinating the preparation of payrolls in USA, France and the Netherlands.
•	Helping in the creation of rules and procedures for the organization. Making sure that processes and procedures are fully documented and continually monitored for improvement.
•	Support to expatriates with all paper work including visas, relocation, etc.
•	Checking incoming invoices and credit notes and ensure that they are according to the contracts.
•	Checking expenses report and making sure that they comply with the Travel & Entertainment policy.
•	Responsible for maintaining the Travel & Entertainment policy updates according to business policy.
•	Preparation of travel arrangements from A to Z plus acting as travel coordinator for the whole group.
•	Liaising with law firms in France, Luxembourg and USA to ensure that all legal documents regarding the corporate structure are made accordingly and deadlines are respected.
•	Drafting correspondence in French and liaising with governmental entities in France regarding meetings with specific Ministries and/or with the French President.
•	Drafting general correspondence in English, French and Spanish.
•	Working closely with the CFO in order to have financial reports ready for the weekly/monthly review.
•	Making Power Point presentations as required.
•	Being available 24/7 in order to fulfill the very busy schedule of the President/CEO.
profile_positions.title: Executive Assistant/PA to Eugenio Minvielle - Founder, President/CEO at Innit International

profile_positions.description:
Give 1-1 executive support to the COO Developed Markets and Member of the Executive Committee D.E. Master Blenders 1753.

Create a platform of trust among COO and his team in order to achieve results.

Prepare his very busy travel schedule and at the same time organizing his calendar keeping focus on the business and results.

Play the key role organizing meetings and events taking place on and off site. Monthly marketing GM's meeting, annual Marketing Conference, etc., ensuring budges are maintained and events are implemented smoothly and professionally.

Preparations of PowerPoint presentations needed for the Monthly Executive Committee and GMs meetings.

Work very close with the GMs of the Western Europe Countries (direct reports to COO) in order to make sure that deadlines are respected and projects are executed accordingly.

Work to ensure smooth running of the marketing department in the COO’s absence. 

Ensure that office’s policies and processes are maintained.

Work with Finance and other departments within marketing to resolve problems and questions when they occur.

Give executive support to VP of Human Resources and VP of Finance; both are direct report to the COO Developed Markets, in order to connect them to the rest of the business in a dinamic, positive and high profesional way.
profile_positions.title: Executive Assistant to Eugenio Minvielle - COO and Member of the Executive Committee
ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGER reporting to Yoav Gazelle - President, Head of Europe RBU

profile_positions.description: Reporting directly to the Site Director in Amsterdam and giving general support to the senior managers and directors in the house. Managing their schedules, coordinate their travels arrangements (plus acting as Travel Coordinator for the whole site), interface with other departments and countries, work to ensure smooth running of the site. Coordination and helping the expats to start their new life in the Netherlands, these includes searching for apartments, taking care that expats get work permit, 30% tax ruling, open new bank accounts, managing the lease car´s contracts, if necessary follow-up the procedures to transfer their car to Holland, etc. Completion of reports such as the Departments Holiday Schedule, and KPI´s to a high quality and on time. Play the lead role in coordinating and organizing weekly team meetings, and trainings for all staff. Ensure that office´s policies and processes are maintained.  Helping the senior manager to create rules and procedures for the house.  Checking incoming invoices and credit notes and ensure that they are according to the contracts. Ensuring that budges are maintained.  Responsible for the day to day office management duties and follow-up of facilities contracts.   (e.g. building support/maintaining, utilities, canteen, security system, etc.). Resolve problems and questions when they occur.
profile_positions.title: OFFICE MANAGER/PERSONAL ASSISTANT TO STEVE DEACON - SITE DIRECTOR

company.name: Liberty Global (former UPC Broadband Holding Services BV)

profile_positions.description: Support the Managing Director of Strategic Marketing, Sales and Care and the group of senior managers from the Marketing Division in managing their schedules, travels, interface with other departments and countries, work to ensure smooth running of the marketing department in the MD’ s absence.  Completion of reports (weekly and monthly) such as the Weekly Sales  & Marketing Report, Department Holiday Schedule, Gene Report, KPI, CAPEX Accruals to a high quality and on time. Play the lead role in coordinating and organizing monthly team meetings, senior marketing management meeting, the annual Marketing and Sales Conference and annual VP’s Conference, other department events working with agencies and other departments as needed, ensuring budges are maintained and event are implemented smoothly and professionally.  Work with Finance and other departments within marketing to resolve problems and questions when they occur.
profile_positions.title: Executive Assistant to Brad Gunn - Managing Director Strategic Marketing, Sales & Care

profile_positions.description: Preparation of letters, reports, legal documents and faxes in English and French.  Preparation of Shareholders meetings, Board meetings and the weekly staff meeting.  This includes sending invitations, documents, and preparations of minutes. Drafting minutes and some legal agreements (power of attorney, loan agreements, etc.).  Incorporation/Registration of companies in the Chamber of Commerce. Liaise with Chamber of Commerce and Tax Office. Responsible for the preparation of invoices and payments (Money Manager).  Compiling information for external auditors such as KPMG, BDO and PriceWaterHouseCoopers  among others. Responsible for preparatory work related to travels and accommodations for office staff.  Updating files and dealing with routine inquiries and other secretarial/administrative tasks as required.
profile_positions.title: Administrative Assistant

profile_positions.description: Preparation of documents and publications, including proofreading, formatting, design, printing, conversions, to include print versions as well as electronic versions for distribution on the WIPO website.  Responsible for ensuring availability of electronic versions of documents and publications on the WIPO website and the Copyright website as well.  This includes conversion of documents and publications in PDF format,  follow-up of distribution of documents and publications to WIPO Member States and National Copyright Offices.  Preparing the Copyright Sector web page in English.  Checking and proofreading outgoing texts in English, French and Spanish. Coordination of text flow (documents, reports) between the Copyright Sector and the translator services (Language Division).  Preparing letters, reports, legal documents and faxes in English, French and Spanish.  Responsible for preparatory work related to missions, preparing cost estimates, programs, and travel authorizations.  Entering data in databases and make database queries for the preparation of reports.  Performing all administrative tasks including drafting and typing letters of invitation and other correspondence related to the organization and follow-up of symposia/seminars/workshops, among others.  Organizing the Director’s agenda.  Responsible of the organization of the Standing Committee on Copyright and Related Rights (twice per year) and the Diplomatic Conference of December 2000, including assistance to delegations.  Giving general support to the group of 15 lawyers working for the two divisions. Updating files and dealing with routine inquiries and other secretarial tasks as required.
profile_positions.title: Secretary (COPYRIGHT LAW DIVISION AND COPYRIGHT E-COMMERCE TECHNOLOGY AND MANAGEMENT DIVISION)
